member.summary: Throws the first faulting exception for a task which is faulted. It preserves the original stack trace when throwing the exception. Note: It is the caller's responsibility not to pass incomplete tasks to this method, because it does degenerate into a call to the equivalent of .Wait() on the task when it hasn't yet completed.

member.summary:
Whether this procedure can always be bound.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.Expressions.PropertyContainer
member.summary: A container of property names and property values.
member.remarks: EntityFramework understands only member initializations in Select expressions. Also, it doesn't understand type casts for non-primitive types. So, SelectExpandBinder has to generate strongly types expressions that involve only property access. This class represents the base class for a bunch of generic derived types that are used in the expressions that SelectExpandBinder generates.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.Expressions.ModelContainer
member.summary: EntityFramework does not let you inject non primitive constant values (like IEdmModel) in Select queries. Primitives like strings and guids can be injected as they can be translated into a SQL query. This container associates a unique string with each EDM model, so that, given the string the model can be retrieved later.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Routing.FunctionResolver
member.summary:
Performs function overload resolution. OData protocol mandates that functions with the same name and same binding parameter (null in case of unbound functions) should have different sets of parameter names i.e two functions with the same name and same binding parameter cannot have the same set of paramter names.
The function overload resolution logic then is a simple matter of figuring out the paramter names and trying to find a function with that parameter names.

member.summary: The ActionLinkGenerationConvention calls action.HasActionLink(..) if the action binds to a single entity and has not previously been configured.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Builder.Conventions.AssociationSetDiscoveryConvention
member.summary: to configure the EDM association sets for the given entity set. This convention adds an association set for each EDM navigation property defined in this type, its base types and all its derived types. The target entity set chosen is the default entity set for the navigation property's target entity type. The default entity set for an entity type is the entity set that contains entries of that entity type. If more than one entity sets match, the default entity set is none. If no entity sets match the default entity set is the default entity set of the base type.

member.summary: override this method to restrict the binary operators inside the filter query. That includes all the logical operators except 'not' and all math operators.
member.remarks: This method is intended to be called from method overrides in subclasses. This method also supports unit-testing scenarios and is not intended to be called from user code. Call the Validate method to validate a instance.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.Validators.FilterQueryValidator.ValidateLogicalOperator(Microsoft.OData.Core.UriParser.Semantic.BinaryOperatorNode,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings)
member.summary:
Override this method to validate the LogicalOperators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or'.
Please note that 'not' is not included here. Please override ValidateUnaryOperatorNode to customize 'not'.

The validation settings.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings
member.summary: This class describes the validation settings for querying.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedFunctions
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query.
The allowed functions include the following:
String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat
e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19
DateTime related: year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds
e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971
Math related: round, floor, ceiling
Type related:isof, cast,
Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a list of allowed logical operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary:
Gets a list of properties one can orderby the result with. Note, by default this list is empty, it means it can be ordered by any property.
For example, having an empty collection means client can order the queryable result by any properties. Adding "Name" to this list means that it only allows queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed inside query. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $inlineCount, $format and $skiptoken.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxOrderByNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of expressions that can be present in the $orderby.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxAnyAllExpressionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.
member.remarks: The default value is 1.
member.value: The maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of the nodes inside the $filter syntax tree.
member.remarks: The default value is 100.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $skip that a client can request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $top that a client can request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataValidationSettings.MaxExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the max expansion depth for the $expand query option.
member.remarks: To disable the maximum expansion depth check, set this property to 0.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Builder.BindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a BindingParameter.
Actions/Functions can have at most one BindingParameter. This parameter has similar semantics to the 'this' keyword in C# extensions methods.
For example given a url that identifies a Movie, if there is an action that has a bindingParameter that is a Movie, you can bind the Action to the url.
i.e. if ~/Movies(1) identifies a Movie, and there exists a Checkout action that has a Movie BindingParameter, you can invoke that Action at this url ~/Movies(1)/Checkout
The BindingParameter type must either be an EntityType or a Collection of EntityTypes.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.OData.Builder.NonbindingParameterConfiguration
member.summary:
Represents a non-binding procedure parameter.
Non binding parameters are provided in the POST body for Actions Non binding parameters are provided in 3 ways for Functions - ~/.../Function(p1=value) - ~/.../Function(p1=@x)?@x=value - ~/.../Function?p1=value (only allowed if the Function is the last url path segment).

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQuerySettings.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.value: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: T:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute
member.summary: This class defines an attribute that can be applied to an action to enable querying using the OData query syntax. To avoid processing unexpected or malicious queries, use the validation settings on to validate incoming queries. For more information, visit http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=279712.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Enables a controller action to support OData query parameters.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.OnActionExecuted(System.Web.Http.Filters.HttpActionExecutedContext)
member.summary: Performs the query composition after action is executed. It first tries to retrieve the IQueryable from the returning response message. It then validates the query from uri based on the validation settings on QueryableAttribute. It finally applies the query appropriately, and reset it back on the response message.
member.param: The context related to this action, including the response message, request message and HttpConfiguration etc.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.ValidateQuery(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Validates the OData query in the incoming request.
member.param: The incoming request.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.
member.remarks: Override this method to perform additional validation of the query. By default, the implementation throws an exception if the query contains unsupported query parameters.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.ApplyQuery(System.Linq.IQueryable,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Applies the query to the given IQueryable based on incoming query from uri and query settings.
member.param: The original queryable instance from the response message.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.
member.remarks: Override this method to perform additional query composition of the query. By default, the implementation supports $top, $skip, $orderby and $filter.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.ApplyQuery(System.Object,System.Web.Http.OData.Query.ODataQueryOptions)
member.summary: Applies the query to the given entity based on incoming query from uri and query settings.
member.param: The original entity from the response message.
The instance constructed based on the incoming request.
member.returns: The new entity after the $select and $expand query has been applied to.

member.name: M:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.GetModel(System.Type,System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.Web.Http.Controllers.HttpActionDescriptor)
member.summary: Gets the EDM model for the given type and request.
member.param: The CLR type to retrieve a model for.
The request message to retrieve a model for.
The action descriptor for the action being queried on.
member.returns: The EDM model for the given type and request.
member.remarks: Override this method to customize the EDM model used for querying.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.EnsureStableOrdering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether query composition should alter the original query when necessary to ensure a stable sort order.
member.value: A true value indicates the original query should be modified when necessary to guarantee a stable sort order. A false value indicates the sort order can be considered stable without modifying the query. Query providers that ensure a stable sort order should set this value to false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.HandleNullPropagation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how null propagation should be handled during query composition.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.EnableConstantParameterization
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether constants should be parameterized. Parameterizing constants would result in better performance with Entity framework.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxAnyAllExpressionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.
member.remarks: This limit helps prevent Denial of Service attacks. The default value is 1.
member.value: The maxiumum depth of the Any or All elements nested inside the query.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of nodes inside the $filter syntax tree.
member.remarks: The default value is 100.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.PageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of query results to send back to clients.
member.value: The maximum number of query results to send back to clients.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedQueryOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the query parameters that are allowed in queries. The default is all query options, including $filter, $skip, $top, $orderby, $expand, $select, $inlineCount, $format and $skiptoken.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedFunctions
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed functions used in the $filter query.
The allowed functions includes the following:
String related: substringof, endswith, startswith, length, indexof, substring, tolower, toupper, trim, concat
e.g. ~/Customers?$filter=length(CompanyName) eq 19
DateTime related: year, years, month, months, day, days, hour, hours, minute, minutes, second, seconds
e.g. ~/Employees?$filter=year(BirthDate) eq 1971
Math related: round, floor, ceiling
Type related:isof, cast,
Collection related: any, all

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedArithmeticOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed arithmetic operators including 'add', 'sub', 'mul', 'div', 'mod'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedLogicalOperators
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents a list of allowed logical Operators such as 'eq', 'ne', 'gt', 'ge', 'lt', 'le', 'and', 'or', 'not'.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.AllowedOrderByProperties
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string with comma seperated list of property names. The queryable result can only be ordered by those properties defined in this list.
Note, by default this string is null, which means it can be ordered by any property.
For example, setting this value to null or empty string means that we allow ordering the queryable result by any properties. Setting this value to "Name" means we only allow queryable result to be ordered by Name property.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxSkip
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $skip that a client can request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the max value of $top that a client can request.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxExpansionDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the max expansion depth for the $expand query option.
member.remarks: To disable the maximum expansion depth check, set this property to 0.

member.name: P:System.Web.Http.QueryableAttribute.MaxOrderByNodeCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of expressions that can be present in the $orderby.
